title: When The Tides Keep Getting Higher
description: As sea levels rise from climate change, coastal communities face a greater risk of chronic flooding. Climate scientist Astrid Caldas and her colleagues have looked at where it's happening now and where it could happen in the future as the tides keep getting higher. Follow host Maddie Sofia on Twitter @maddie_sofia. Email the show at shortwave@npr.org.

itunes:title: When The Tides Keep Getting Higher
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Rising sea levels are creating higher tides, and coastal communities are asking tough questions about whether or not they can keep up.
itunes:subtitle: Rising sea levels are creating higher tides, and coastal communities are asking tough questions about whether or not they can keep up.
